questions.question_text: What are their high level tasks and goals?
questions.question_answers: Learn coding concepts in a fun and creative environment with a group of friends

context_array.section_title: Test whether this design problem (i.e requires a design solution)

questions.question_text: Are users struggling to accomplish their goals (what are their struggles?)
questions.question_answers: Few platforms that encourage learning computer science skills in a collaborative and creative environment, may view coding as a “loner” or non-expressive activity

questions.question_text: Are these struggles the result of a design challenge?
Can the problem already be solved with current technology?
questions.question_answers: Can be solved with current tech

questions.question_text: Why do they care (is this problem important?)
questions.question_answers: people who don’t have exposure to computer science at an early age or only have experience coding in a class setting may not see how coding can be applied to creative purposes

questions.question_text: What’s your problem statement? (does it capture a core tension? Agent wants X but Y)
questions.question_answers: learners would like to be able to work with people to express creativity through code, but are discouraged from doing so because many learning environments don’t include creativity as a part of the curriculum. Users are interested in computer science and want to
